ovdesc.p:
This table would be used to record the actual values against each data type. System would calculate data group values, ratios, score and assign exposure levels (limits) to the borrower.
The data required to be captured could be indicated by selecting the appropriate ID of SA.SCORE.DATA (loan product ID). Based on this system would default the data types/data groups required to be captured, ratios to be calculated. Once the actual values are input and PERFORM.CALC is set to YES, system would do the credit scoring by choosing the appropriate score card and assign a limit.
Score card selection for credit scoring would be based on the following rules;
1) If there exists only one score card for the product then it would used for scoring
2) If there exists multiple score cards for a product based on certain customer attribute (as defined in parameter file), system would try to match the customer's attribute with the relevant score card, else, score card defined at product level would be used for credit scoring.
If the limit is granted in foreign currency, the currency of the limit and the exchange rate that is to be reckoned may also be defined.

A unique reference number which identifies a particular contract.
Contract numbers can be generated either a) manually or b) automatically. For automatic generation the appropriate indicator must be set by the system supervisor. Where automatic generation is supported depression of the F3 key at the "Awaiting ID" prompt supplies the next contract number.
In instances where manual number generation is followed, the sequence number is the only mandatory data element. The system will supply the remainder based on the current application date.
Once the contract is authorised this field cannot be changed.
Julian date must be equal to the application date.
Defaulted from corresponding field in SA.SCORE.LIMIT based on credit scoring
Recommended limit for the aggregate score in AGG.SCORE field.
Upto 35 character alphanumeric description field. Multivalue field to enable description in local language

This field merely indicates whether the assets and liabilities match. To ensure data integrity for corporate applicants, it may be desirable to check if values for asset data types and values for liability data types match. Whether the data type is an asset or liability is indicated in SA.DATA.TYPES. System would perform this check for those data types
Only allowed values are BALANCED and IMBALANCE

This field is used to input the actual limit that is intended to be granted to the customer. User may input an amount that is less than the recommended limit. However, if the input in this field is more than the value in Rec.Limit, a suitable override would be raised

If the limit is to be granted in a different currency the exchange rate at which the system defaulted exposure or user input exposure (in field GRANT.LIMIT) must be converted must be input here.
System would apply MID rate if exchange rate is not input.

Represents the data type forming a part of the data group defaulted by the system. System would default the data types based on the definition in SA.DATA.GROUP. Subvalue field to accomodate multiple data types forming a part of data group.

Once all the values pertaining to the customer have been entered this field may be set to YES. System would then calculate the data group totals, perform ratio calculation, select the appropriate score card, arrive at the score and assign a limit (if defined). User may change the amounts of the financial items and re-calculate the ratios each time by hitting YES in this field.
Only allowed values are YES and NO

Must be a valid record in CURRENCY table.
